intro: Saurauia pseudopringlei var. fluviatilis, commonly known as the river saurauia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and riverbanks. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, dark berries as fruit. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to survive.
